conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with visible thickness, angled elevated view, and roof/ceiling removed exposing interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; angled view is appropriate with minimal distortion; cutaway is clean with only minor simplification at some wall tops/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Room set largely matches: bedroom (top-left), toilet/bath (top-middle/right), utility (top-right), kitchen (right), living/dining (center), balcony (bottom-left). Adjacencies are mostly faithful; foyer separation at bottom-right is less explicit and some partition lengths/opening positions appear slightly adjusted.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures present (bed, sofa, dining table, kitchen counters/appliances, bathroom fixtures, utility machine). Minor omissions/simplifications in built-ins (e.g., wardrobes/compact elements) and some pieces are generic blocks.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable and interiors are visible; lighting is adequate. Some areas (entry/foyer and a few door gaps) are slightly ambiguous due to uniform materials and simplified detailing.

detected_errors.description: Foyer/entry zone at bottom-right is not as clearly partitioned/defined as in the 2D plan, suggesting minor layout simplification.
Some door/window opening placements and proportions appear simplified compared to the 2D plan (not all openings are clearly represented with exact swing/location).
Certain small built-ins (e.g., closet/wardrobe indications) are simplified or not fully matched to the 2D plan.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity and complete major spaces, with only minor simplifications to the foyer definition and some opening/details.
